wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier-General John Frederick Hepburn-Stuart-Forbes-Trefusis,  (14 January 1878 – 24 October 1915), known as  'Jack Tre', was a British Army officer in World War I. At the time of his death he was the youngest Brigadier-General in the British Army.

response: * Brigadier-General Hon. John Frederick Hepburn-Stuart-Forbes-Trefusis, DSO (14 January 1878 – died of wounds 24 October 1915)
*Brigadier-General John Frederick Hepburn-Stuart-Forbes-Trefusis (1878–1915), , British Army officer in World War I
